page.title: 12The Wildfowl Trust
page.content: The{Arundel Wildfowl Trust}is one of 3 in England, it was opened 10 years ago. There are 60 acres of wetland, lakes and rough grassland with 850 wildfowl of 85 different species. Some of the birds at the Trust are wild and some are partly tame collection birds. The Wildfowl Trust has 3 main objectives:{enjoyment, education and {breeding.}In the past few years, two species of wildfowl have become extinct worldwide. The Trust breeds rare birds and returns them to their native habitat. Three recent projects have involved Thailand, Hungary and Australia. 16,000 schoolchildren visit the trust every year as well as thousands of adults.
